column4: i understand the GPL says this, but ultimately what is the purpose/benefit to the end-user? by making use of my commercial more difficult because they dont have the skill to get the third part software themselves?

another similar thought. what about selling web SERVICES utilizing open source (GPL) software? such as if i had some portal site that used a gpl webmail client, would that be a problem? there's no distribution at all, its a web service
One benefit to the end user is that if more people write GPL software, then every user gets to use it.
Including the users who wrote the libraries, so part of their "payment" for that effort is that they get to use other people's free software.
